content.text: State a part of the graph that shows the car at rest
State a part of the graph that shows the car moving with constant speed
During part of the journey the car decelerates
Calculate the distance travelled by the car when it is decelerating
distance travelled = .........\(m\)
Different parts of the journey are labelled A, B, C, D and E
Another car accelerates, from rest, starting at time 0s. This car has a constant acceleration. Its speed at 20s is \(10 \text{m / s}\)
On Fig. 1.1, draw a line to show this motion
Describe, using Fig. 1.1, how you can decide which car has the greater acceleration
Fig. 1.1 shows how the speed of a car varies over a short time
The student determines the mass of the stone and its volume
Use the labels K, L, M and N from Fig. 2.1 and Fig. 2.2 to show how to calculate the mass and the volume of the stone
mass of stone = reading ............. minus reading
volume of stone = reading ............ minus reading
The student obtained the following values
mass of stone =  .........78.0g
volume of stone =  .........30.0 cm³
Calculate the density of the stone. Include the unit
A student wants to find the density of a small stone. Fig. 2.1 shows a measuring cylinder, containing water, placed on a balance
The stone is placed in the water as shown in Fig. 2.2
Explain the meaning of centre of mass
Calculate the distance \(x\) from the pivot to the string
distance from pivot = .........\(cm\)
Calculate the mass of the \(2.5 \text{N}\) load
Fig. 3.2 shows a load of \(2.5 \text{N}\) on one side of the beam. The beam is balanced by a load of \(1.5 \text{N}\) suspended by a thin string
Fig. 3.1 shows a beam on a pivot. The beam is balanced at its centre of mass
State the name of the process that releases energy in the nuclear reactor
Suggest a suitable radioactive material used for the fuel rods
Below are four statements that describe the operation of a nuclear power station
They are **not** in the correct order
J
The generator produces electricity
K
The energy is used to boil water
L
The nuclei split, releasing energy
M
The steam drives a turbine
Place the statements in the correct order
The nuclear reactor is contained in a very thick concrete casing. Suggest why
Suggest one advantage and one disadvantage of a nuclear power station compared with a wind turbine
advantage
disadvantage
Wind turbines use a renewable source of energy
State the name of another renewable source of energy
Nuclear power stations produce a useful form of energy. Fig. 4.1 shows part of a nuclear reactor
Calculate the pressure that the post exerts on the ground
pressure = .........N/cm²
A farmer cuts the bottom of one of the posts to make it more pointed. The bucket applies the same force as before
Explain the effect this has on the pressure exerted by the post on the ground
The bucket at the front of a tractor is used to push fence posts down into the ground, as shown in Fig. 5.1
The area of each post in contact with the ground is \(100 \text{cm}^2\). When the bucket pushes a post, the downward force from the post on the ground is \(6500 \text{N}\)
Each diagram in Fig. 6.2 shows a change of state
Add the correct label for each change. The first has been done for you
Some gas is heated at constant pressure
Describe what happens to the molecules of gas as the temperature increases
Fig. 6.3 shows a metal bar
When the metal bar is heated, the bar expands
Identify the dimensions that increase in size when the bar is heated
Tick \((\checkmark)\) all boxes that apply
State one **use** and one **disadvantage** of the expansion of materials when they are heated
use
disadvantage
Water can exist as ice, liquid water and steam. Fig. 6.1 represents the arrangement of the molecules in the three forms of water
Complete the sentences about the wave. Use words from the box
The wave transfers
The number of waves per second passing point P is the
The distance between P and Q is the
The distance between points Q and R is the
The wave on the string is an example of a transverse wave
Explain how a transverse wave differs from a longitudinal wave
Fig. 7.1 represents a wave on a string
People on a container ship see the flash before they hear the bang
Explain why
Explain why they hear two bangs
The speed of sound in air is \(330 \text{m/s}\). The firework explodes at a distance of \(1.0 \text{km}\) from the container ship
Calculate the time for the first bang to reach the people on the container ship
2. Estimate the time delay between hearing the first bang and second bang
The people on the container ship hear two bangs. They hear the second bang shortly after the first bang
A cruise ship has a firework display near a cliff as shown in Fig. 8.1
A firework is sent into the air from the cruise ship. The firework explodes with a bright flash of light and a loud bang
Fig. 9.1 shows an electric heating element in a beaker containing water. The heating element is switched on
Explain how thermal energy is transferred throughout the water in the beaker. Use ideas about density and expansion in your answer
Determine the angle of incidence of the ray on mirror A
angle of incidence = .........
The ray is also reflected from mirror B
On Fig. 10.1, continue the path of the ray of light. Show the position of the reflected ray and the normal to mirror B
On Fig. 10.1, use the letter \(r\) to label the angle of reflection from mirror B
State the law you used to complete the ray diagram
Fig. 10.1 shows two mirrors placed at right angles to each other. A ray of light is incident on mirror A, which is then reflected towards mirror B
State a material from which an electrical conductor can be made
A centre-zero meter measures the electromotive force (e.m.f.) across the conductor
State the unit of e.m.f
State what, if anything, is shown by the centre-zero meter when the conductor is moved
• horizontally, from side-to-side, between the poles of the magnet,
• vertically, up-and-down, between the poles of the magnet
State two factors that affect the size of the e.m.f. across the conductor
An electrical conductor is placed between the poles of a magnet as shown in Fig. 11.1
An atom contains three types of particle
Complete the table with the name of each type of particle
Draw a labelled diagram to show the structure of a lithium atom, \(^{7}_{3}\mathrm{Li}\)
This question is about the structure of an atom
